results.title: Tennant Creek in passing
results.creator_credit: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film views Tennant Creek in the form of a passing glimpse, beginning with some long-shot filming of the natural environment and mines at sunrise in an approach to the town, focusing on buildings, inhabitants, passing vehicles and travellers, and completing the view with aerial shots moving away from Tennant Creek at sunset.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Coffey, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia

results.title: Tender mercies
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Robert Duvall, Horton Foote, Antron Media and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: A compassionate love story tracing the relationship between a burnt-out country and western star and a young widow he meets in a Texas motel. His past is littered with the spoils of fame and scarred by alcoholism, two broken marriages and a painful descent from stardom so that he lacks confidence in relationships and has a low opinion of himself and others. The widow and her young son help him to rebuild his life and to appreciate the healing power of affection. Stars Robert Duvall and Tess Harper.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Beresford, Robert Duvall, Horton Foote, Antron Media and EMI/Parlophone

results.title: Tender is the night
results.brief_description: This lavish production of F. Scott Fitzgerald’s “Tender is the Night” is set against the sumptuous background of the playgrounds of Europe during the 1920s. Dick Diver, a brilliant young American psychiatrist, falls in love with Nicole Warren, a beautiful but schizophrenic American heiress. They make a stylish, glamorous couple and in the carnival atmosphere of the 1920s enjoy a lavish lifestyle on the French Riviera, in Paris and in Switzerland. This brings them a fascinating circle of friends, but rivalries and conflicting passions within the group strain their relationship and take a heavy toll on Nicole’s fragile health. For Dick, the intertwining of lives with Nicole ends in tragedy. Screenplay by Dennis Potter.

results.title: Ten years from Colombo
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Ten years after the Colombo Plan, the people of Pakistan, Ceylon and other ancient lands envisage a future of material prosperity brought about through mutual cooperation.

results.title: Ten million strong
results.brief_description: Shows the different ways of life of the various racial groups in Malaysia, and demonstrates that Malaysia is divided more by the contrast between rich and poor than by racial prejudice.

results.title: Childhood matters
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 26 of Series “Time to grow”.
In this final episode of the “Time to grow” series, issues are raised on child development and importantly on the question, “Does childhood matter?”. It summarises the other programs in the series and endeavours to give a complete overview of child development from infancy to adolescence.

results.title: Preschool social development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discusses developments such as emergence of a sense of morality, need for approval, gender identity, emotional regulation. Importance of adequate attachment experiences is stressed.

results.title: The typical twos
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Time to grow”.
Three case studies of two year-olds and their parents: Tyler, from a middle class family, Dominic, an American Indian, and Becky, from a low-income single parent family show the tensions between the needs for autonomy and attachment.
